definition[0]: to make someone leave their job when they are old or ill, and pay them a pension
example[0]: Not everyone wants to be pensioned off at 65.
definition[1]: to get rid of something because it is old or not useful anymore
example[1]: Many of the old ships have been pensioned off.
definition[2]: to make someone who is old or ill leave their job and pay them a pension
example[2]: He had worked hard all his life, and in three years they would pension him off.
definition[3]: to get rid of something because it is too old or not useful any more
example[3]: Old coal-fired power stations will be pensioned off.
